world-war-two.title: World War II Major Events (1939-1945)
world-war-two.description: Key battles, campaigns, and significant events of World War II

events.title: Invasion of Poland
events.description: Germany invades Poland, marking the beginning of World War II in Europe. The Blitzkrieg tactics proved devastatingly effective.

events.title: Battle of Britain
events.description: The German Luftwaffe's sustained bombing campaign against the UK. The RAF's successful defense prevented German invasion.
events.casualties: ~2,500 RAF personnel killed, ~23,000 British civilians killed

events.title: Operation Barbarossa
events.description: Germany launches the largest military invasion in history against the Soviet Union, opening the Eastern Front.
events.casualties: ~5 million Axis casualties, ~27 million Soviet casualties

events.title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
events.description: Japan launches a surprise attack on the US naval base at Pearl Harbor, bringing the United States into World War II.
events.casualties: ~2,400 American military personnel and civilians killed

events.title: Battle of Midway
events.description: Decisive naval battle in the Pacific Theater. US forces defeated the Japanese fleet, marking a turning point in the Pacific War.

events.title: Battle of Stalingrad
events.description: Brutal urban warfare that became a turning point on the Eastern Front. German 6th Army was completely destroyed.

events.title: Battle of Kursk
events.description: The largest tank battle in history. German offensive Operation Citadel was decisively defeated by Soviet forces.

events.title: D-Day Normandy Landings
events.description: Operation Overlord - the largest seaborne invasion in history. Allied forces successfully established a foothold in Nazi-occupied Europe.

events.title: Liberation of Paris
events.description: Allied forces liberate Paris after four years of German occupation. General de Gaulle leads the Free French into the city.

events.title: Battle of the Bulge
events.description: Germany's last major offensive on the Western Front. Despite initial success, the offensive ultimately failed.

events.title: Crossing of the Rhine
events.description: Allied forces cross the Rhine River at Remagen, breaching Germany's last major defensive barrier in the west.

events.title: Battle of Berlin
events.description: Final major battle in Europe. Soviet forces capture Berlin, leading to Hitler's suicide and Germany's surrender.

events.title: Atomic Bombing of Hiroshima
events.description: The first use of atomic weapons in warfare. The bombing devastated the city and hastened Japan's surrender.

events.title: Atomic Bombing of Nagasaki
events.description: The second atomic bomb dropped on Japan. This, combined with Soviet invasion of Manchuria, led to Japan's surrender.

events.title: Victory over Japan Day
events.description: Japan announces its surrender, effectively ending World War II. Formal surrender ceremony held on USS Missouri in Tokyo Bay.

french-revolution.title: The French Revolution (1789–1799)
french-revolution.description: Major events and turning points of the French Revolution

events.title: Estates-General Assembly
events.description: King Louis XVI called an assembly at Versailles to address France's financial crisis, but it ultimately failed to resolve tensions between the estates.

events.title: Formation of National Assembly
events.description: The Third Estate declared itself as the National Assembly, pledging not to disperse until they gave France a new constitution.

events.title: Storming of the Bastille
events.description: Angry Parisians stormed the Bastille fortress, a symbol of royal tyranny. This marked the start of the revolution as the King recognized the sovereignty of his people.

events.title: Declaration of Rights of Man and Citizen
events.description: Document expressing principles of liberty, equality and fraternity, inspired by Enlightenment ideologies.

events.title: Women's March on Versailles
events.description: Concerned over the high price of bread, thousands of women rioted and marched to Versailles, forcing the royal family to return to Paris.

events.title: Execution of King Louis XVI
events.description: Marked the end of the monarchy and establishment of the First French Republic. Louis XVI was executed by guillotine for treason, shocking Europe.

events.title: Beginning of Reign of Terror
events.description: Led by Robespierre, this period saw mass executions of enemies of the revolution, creating an atmosphere of fear across France.

events.title: Execution of Marie Antoinette
events.description: Queen Marie Antoinette, unpopular for her perceived extravagance during times of poverty, was executed by guillotine.

events.title: Fall of Robespierre
events.description: Maximilien Robespierre was arrested and executed by his political rivals, ending the Reign of Terror and beginning a more moderate phase.

events.title: Napoleon's Coup d'État
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte staged a coup and seized power, ending the revolutionary government and establishing himself as leader, transitioning France from revolutionary ideals to authoritarian rule.
